poem:
"Musing on Nigella's Christmas"

Amsterdam, dear Nigella, traced with canals and cheer,
For Christmas you chose the Dutch, their hearty beer.
A silencing finger on curious lips, a boat adrift.
A feast within tidewater confines, a gift.
No need for questions, let the story bask in its own light,
A floating, roving Christmas, wrapped in Netherland night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling optimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nigella’s Amsterdam Christmas review – this gorgeous festive outing is food-based poetry It is best not to ask questions about Nigella’s Amsterdam Christmas. Do not ask why Nigella has gone to the Netherlands for her festive feast. Why is she hosting a Dutch Christmas party? Hush now, a finger on the lips. Why is she cooking on a boat? It is a boat so gorgeous that TV’s last lovely houseboat, the one in Copenhagen from". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
